comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: Impressive view. The spelling of the firm is not correct, it is Linke-Hofmann from Breslau (today in Poland with the name Wrocław). The Linke-Hofmann firm was a big industrial German firm who specialized in railway stock and heavy locomotives. In 1916 they started a department for aviation [Abteilung Flugzeugbau] which produced their two Riesenflugzeug designs R.I and R.II. Both were very special. The R.II was a 'blown up' normal biplane to extreme dimensions, which had in the nose section 4 coupled engines delivering 1000 hp together and driving a two-bladed propeller of 6,70 / 6,80 meter diameter. The R.II was completed and flown after the war and then probably broken up due to the armistice or the Versailles Peace Treaty terms. de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Datei:Linke-Hofmann-Werke_(1913).jpg
